glosses: nomadic tent made of felt, like a yurt or ger
hut or shelter made of twigs and branches

etymology:
Inherited from Ottoman Turkish آلاچق (alaçık, alaçak, “yurt, nomad's tent”), from Proto-Turkic *alāču (“tent, hut”), a word which usually have final -k in a lot of later forms.
Cognates
Cognate with Azerbaijani alaçıq, Bashkir аласыҡ (alasıq), Chagatai الاچوق (alačuq), Chuvash лаҫӑ (laś̬ă), Kazakh лашық (laşyq), Kumyk алачыкъ (alaçıq), Kyrgyz алачык (alacık), Southern Altai аланчык (alančïk), Tatar алачык (alaçıq), Tuvan алажы (alajı) and Uzbek olachiq
